page.title: 03Milk Production Mickleton
page.content: On average each of Mr Hoggin's cows produces 5500kg (1200galls) of milk in each lactation period.He is one of Mickleton's milkmen and delivers milk in the village.He charges 23 pence a pint retail,or is paid 15 pence a litre wholesale when he sells it to the Milk Marketing Board.The milk he sells does not have to be pasteurised. Sometimes a cow might get mastitis. This is treated with anti-biotics.The milk from an infected cow is no good for cheese-making because the helpful bacteria are killed off. Mr Hoggins has three tractors on his farm.Apart from himself,he employs one full-time and one part-time worker. The farmhouse is almost in the middle of the village and is built of the local limestone.
